content: "http://www.journalgazette.net/article/20090508/FEAT04/905089924" quote: Former presidential candidate Alan Keyes and 21 others have been arrested on trespassing charges after marching on the University of Notre Dame campus to protest President Obama’s upcoming commencement speech. About 75 protesters gathered Friday outside the school’s front gate for 35 minutes, reciting the "Hail Mary" and other prayers and listening to Keyes speak before about 30 of them walked onto campus, some intending to be arrested. Those who were arrested were handcuffed and taken to the St. Joseph County Jail, where they faced being held on $250 bond. The protesters are upset at Notre Dame for inviting Obama to speak at the May 17 commencement because of the president’s support of abortion rights and embryonic stem-cell research. Birther, noun: Someone who seriously believes that Barack Obama is not Constitutionally qualified to be President of the United States because they contest his place of birth (According to them, he was not born in the State of Hawaii, but on Io, one of the moons of Jupiter). A sub-sect of Birthers also believes that Senator John McCain was not Constitutionally qualified to be President of the United States because of his place of birth (Canal Zone, Panama). In case you may have forgotten, Alan Keyes has filed suit in court that he should be awarded the Presidency, since in his mind, both Barack Obama and John McCain were not Constitutionally qualified to be President and he is. I suspect Keyes was told this by a burning bush somewhere...
